DOC.HEADLINE: Haitian child quake victims flown to US for care

TEXT.P: Doctors say they have skirted a bureaucratic logjam to save the life of two critically ill children who were victims of Haiti's earthquake.
Dr. Phuoc Le of Boston-based Partners in Health says a 5-year-old girl and a 14-month-old boy were put on a private medical evacuation jet on Sunday and flown to Children's Hospital of Philadelphia.

Efforts to get the girl with tetanus to the U.S. had been in doubt after the U.S. military stopped its medical evacuation flights on Wednesday night over whether state or federal officials should pay for treating patients. The boy has pneumonia.
